newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Ringgit stays in range, seen subdued by dlr/majors.
newsitem.headline: Ringgit stays in range, seen subdued by dlr/majors.

text.p: The ringgit was rangebound at the close of the Asian day as a strong dollar/yen rally subdued most of the regional currencies, dealers said.
They said the ringgit was also affected by some unwinding of positions against other currencies like the yen and Singapore dollar.
However, sentiment towards the ringgit remained positive, with another rally seen following the ongoing correction.
"The ringgit would slip to around 2.4920 a dollar and recover to probably test its recent high of 2.4680," a dealer with a Malaysian bank said.
"There is a general winding back of ringgit positions against most currencies," said the head of dealing at another European bank in Singapore.
Dealers said Malaysia's November trade data, which was widely expected to show a deficit, would trigger the ringgit's decline to below 2.49 a dollar level.
In a poll by Reuters on Tuesday, 10 research houses forecast an average trade deficit of 148 million ringgit for November, 1996.
The trade data is expected to be announced this week.
At 1000 GMT, the ringgit was at 2.4832/39 a dollar.
